page.title: 17A Letter From Helen.
page.content: Dear BBC, I have heard about your Domesday project and I like the idea very much. Our type of land is mainly farming and few roads. We have odd shops here and there and school buildings. We have a church, a village hall, a school, a park, a golf course and a sewage plant. Our school field has trees surrounding it and it is 1 acre (counting our car park). There are 2 lorry transport centres and they travel to the sugar beet factory and back. But there are risks of danger to every child. We have a river called the River Glen and our fishermen are fine. We have a Sluice and there are lots and lots of boats. Yours Sincerely, Helen Rowbottom (Age 9)
